alert.note: Alert for Estill; Jackson; Lee; Menifee; Morgan; Powell; Wolfe (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 06 at 4:53PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Powell, west central Morgan, central Estill, north central Jackson, southeastern Menifee, Lee and Wolfe Counties through 530 PM EDT... At 453 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong showers and thunderstorms along a line extending from Willow Tree to Wagersville to Brazil. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Furnace, Texola, Pryse, Shade, Fitchburg, Crystal, Cobhill, Pitts and Willow Tree around 500 PM EDT. Rogers Chapel, Greeley, Patsey and Pilot around 505 PM EDT. Slade, Willow Shoals, Standing Rock, Nada, Leeco, Fixer, Natural Bridge S.P., Evelyn, Zachariah and Pinnacle around 510 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Torrent, Red River Gorge, Rogers, Mount Olive, Whynot, Whisman, Old Landing, Koomer Ridge Campground, Glencairn, Belle Point, Beattyville, High Falls, Pine Ridge, Jenson, Maloney, St. Helens, Campton, Fincastle, Stoll, Calaboose, Pomeroyton, Stillwater, Maytown, Valeria, Booth, Vada, Ezel, Grannie, Toliver, Trent, Gosneyville, Mary, Hazel Green, Flat, Vortex and Murphyfork. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Estill; Jackson; Lee; Menifee; Morgan; Powell; Wolfe
